customer_name: Levi, Daniel, Jeremy and Titus Miller

citations.narrative:
The outdoor housing enclosure containing 1 adult husky, and 7 juvenile huskies have multiple holes dug into the ground
leaving large gaps underneath both sides of the fencing in the enclosure. During the time of inspection, a single juvenile
husky was observed to crawl under the fence through one of the holes into the adjacent enclosure housing 2 juvenile
Bernese Mountain dogs. The juvenile husky immediately crawled back into it’s enclosure.
The dogs could potentially become stuck under the fencing, escape, or be injured due to not properly maintaining housing
facilities in good repair. Housing facilities for dogs must be designed and constructed so they are structurally sound. They
must be kept in good repair, and they must protect the animals from injury, contain the animals securely, and restrict other
animals from entering.
Correct by 6 November 2024
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the facility representative.
n

narrative:
3.1(a) 
   
Housing facilities, general. 
The outdoor housing enclosure containing 1 adult husky, and 7 juvenile huskies have multiple holes dug into the ground 
leaving large gaps underneath both sides of the fencing in the enclosure. During the time of inspection, a single juvenile 
husky was observed to crawl under the fence through one of the holes into the adjacent enclosure housing 2 juvenile 
Bernese Mountain dogs. The juvenile husky immediately crawled back into it’s enclosure.  
 
The dogs could potentially become stuck under the fencing, escape, or be injured due to not properly maintaining housing 
facilities in good repair. Housing facilities for dogs must be designed and constructed so they are structurally sound. They 
must be kept in good repair, and they must protect the animals from injury, contain the animals securely, and restrict other 
animals from entering.  
 
Correct by 6 November 2024 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the facility representative. 
 
 n
